column5: Just got back from Scout Lake Resort on Lac Seul. Fishing was great, resort was excellent. If anyone is looking for a great place to go that won't cost an arm and a leg, e-mail me and I'll give you a full report.
HEY NATE DID YOU SMELL MY PIPE ON THE LAKE?
Dear Nate, I'm dying to know, if you solved the minnow-leech -crawlers mystery.Minnows for fish--leeches for omlettes-- crawlers for clearing trees. Glad you had a good trip. No_Fish
Come to think of it...I did catch a whiff of something...Of course my boatmate was puff'n on a H. Upman most of the time, so it'd been hard to tell!
Save the dead minnows, they work well on a pizza! If the pizza is reall big, keep a couple perch!

>Just got back from Scout Lake >Resort on Lac Seul. Fishing >was great, resort was excellent. >If anyone is looking for >a great place to go >that won't cost an arm >and a leg, e-mail me >and I'll give you a >full report. Just read your message this morning. Am leaving for Lac Suel, Wapesi Bay in 24 hours. Whats the secrets this time of year up there?!

I fish Wapesi often. In the middle of the bay there is a huge island that runs half the bay. Go to the far west end and you will see two points of the end. Follow the southern most point out straight west and you will note that there is a huge flat that is 20'-25' deep. Follow the outside drop all around the perimeter and troll with bottom bouncers and crawlers or minnows. We average 30-50 fish a day from there 20-28" + there are HUGE muskies on that flat as well as some big pike. I am usually there in July. This year I can't make it till Sept. first. Are you doing the houseboat thing or Andersons fly ins?Would like to know how you did when you return. Good luck!
